fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34315].
  {panel}

Below is the suggested improvement from one of our customer:

It would be great if there is support for Oracle JCE in addition to Bouncy Castle to be able to make use of AES Intrinsics and thus speed up trusted app handshakes.

In confluence with a page with many JIRA issues, I see significant delays and CPU consumption by DefaultTrustedApplication.verifySignature - spend in Bouncy Castle math.

From research I assume that this could be sped up by factor of 2-3 when using the AESIntrinsics available Oracle JVM's (1.7 recent).
See -XX:+UseAES -XX:+UseAESIntrinsics

However I think this requires the use of Oracle JCE, not Bouncy Castle.
fields.summary: Support for Sun JCE in addition to Bouncy Castle to be able to make use of AES Intrinsics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34304].
  {panel}

Steps:
- Open confluence editor 
- Add an image has size (2000x2000) in the insert image dialog
- insert it into page
- *NOW*, if you click on the properties, you will be able to add effect for the image
- Save the page, edit again, click on the properties you will see message ( "the file sizes is too big to apply effect")

Issues:
- Issue #1: It behave differently with the new insert case and after you save the page and modify image
- Issue #2: In my opinion, we should allow user to apply effect for "an instance" of the image that user already reduce the size. The reason is, when you apply the effect, you only apply it for "an instance". I tested by insert 2 instances of the SAME SMALL image in page and apply 2 different effects for them, and it's OK. So, if that instance is small enough to apply effect, then allow them to do so.
fields.summary: Images effects should be able to be applied if user reduce the size of the image

Hi Atlassian Support,

Currently, we are working to upgrade our Confluence platform to the latest version. We also would like to make it support external CAS for authentication that requires us to change all existing login usernames to another format.

The current usernames are in short names and we look to find a way to do bulk right-padding with a common string '@something.com' for all usernames.

I hope I have expressed well our requirement. Looking forward to hearing from you.

Thanks,
Sam

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34300].
  {panel}

It seems recently there's been a trend of data placed in confluence_home/indexes/ that cannot be regenerated. This includes:

* /edge index (to show popular pages in the popular tab)
* /questions-edge index (to show which questions in Questions are popular)

Can we please have these located elsewhere? It's very difficult to know if new plugins installed are utilizing that folder. We normally exclude everying within the /indexes directory.

It's been standard recommendation in the docs that [indexes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Home+and+other+important+directories] can be safely rebuilt which is no longer true.
fields.summary: Relocate edge indexes

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25 02 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at [CONFSERVER-29189 - PDF/Word export of gadget from JIRA renders html markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29189]. This is a current and verified bug in Confuence, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}

We use jira filter gadgets on Confluence pages as a quick way of providing reports to our clients of their current issues.  this generally works very well.

However, clients have been complaining that there is no easy way to print the pages, and there seem to be two bugs here:

1. If you use the standard browser print functionality (right click, print) then the printed pages do not include all the rows, or all the columns, that are visible on screen.  A lot gets cut off

2. If you use "Export to PDF" or "Export to Word" you get a load of garbled text, rather than the contents of the table.

Consequently our users are complaining that there is no easy way to print these reports from Confluence, which is a problem.  To workaround, we've given them links to the filters in Jira, but this was what we were trying to avoid!

Screenshots attached
fields.summary: Printing Confluence pages that use Jira Filter gadget doesn't work
search for text in images attached in Confluence

fields.description:
We are currently using 5.1.4.  I created a page template in a space and added a label to the template.  The label is "a13".
User create pages from the template and the label is present just as it should be.
After a month I change the labels using the Label edit on the pages.  I remove "a13" and add "a13done".
On another page I have 2 "Page Properties Report" macros.  On that lists all the "a13" labeled pages and another that list the "a13done" labeled pages.
The problem is that anytime you view the pages where "a13" was removed, "a13" reappears and you have to remove it again.
Once removed, and the page NOT refreshed, I click on the bread crumb back to the page with the "Page Properties Report" macros and the show up in the correct macro.
Again everytime you view the pages where the label from the template is removed the original label reappears.
fields.summary: Unable to remove a label from a page created by a template with a label.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34288].
  {panel}

When using an evaluation license during installation of Confluence OnDemand 5.5-OD-28-010 or in the BTF version of Confluence 5.6.1 Download version, it bypasses the database type setup screen and only uses HSQLDB, skipping directly to the User Management screen.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Download and install [Confluence 5.5-OD-28-010|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-od] or Confluence 5.6.1
# Under Production Installation click Start Setup button
# Paste in a Confluence evaluation license and hit next

h3. Expected behavior
User would be presented with the Choose a Database Configuration screen, and be able to setup whatever DB they want.

h3. Actual behavior
Confluence setup immediately selects HSQLDB and the user is eventually presented with the Configure User Management screen, completely bypassing Choose a Database Configuration screen.

h3. Workaround
* Use a non-evaluation license (ex. commercial license, developer license, etc) while installing 5.6.1
* If you are evaluating Confluence and must use an evaluation license, install Confluence 5.5.6 with an evaluation license (this will allow you to choose an external database), then upgrade to 5.6.1
fields.summary: Confluence defaults to HSQLDB when using evaluation license

fields.description:
When you create a new Demonstration Space, there are several pages under the "_InclusionsLibrary" page that are not uptodate or are unused (not included anywhere).

For example, the "_Archiving" page contains some very old information about the [Archiving Plugin for Confluence|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/123], the screenshots are outdated (several version old) and the link to the plugin documentation should be [http://www.midori-global.com/products/confluence-archiving-plugin/documentation/] and not [https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/x/aYAi] (which is broken as that Confluence instance was stopped a long time ago).

The "_Mobile Clients" page contains links to the non-existing product"Mini Confluence", and the live demo link (http://sandbox.onconfluence.com/m) of RefinedWiki Mobile Interface is broken as well...

The "_Scroll Office" page contains broken links like [http://k15t.com/display/OFCE/Home]...

And so, and so forth. All those pages should be reviewed.

It's important to have 100% consistency here, as this space is the first piece of content that evaluators meet during their journey with Confluence. Not a good impression.
fields.summary: Demonstration Space Contain Broken Link and out-of-date Pages

fields.description:
h4. Steps To Reproduce:

# Create a Page in Confluence.
# Add *4* lines of text to the page.
## Text1
## Text2
## Text3
## Text4
# Point the cursor to end of Text3.
# Use backspace to delete a bullet in a list of bullet points.

h4.Expected Results:

In Firefox, bullet will be removed and the white space is remaining.
 
h4.Actual Results:

In IE 10 and IE 11, cursor move to the bullet point below (in this example Text4).
fields.summary: Deleting a Bullet Point in IE 10 and IE11 does not collapse space white space

fields.description:
Apply a bullet to a text in IE 10 and IE 11 Jumps to the Top Row and Applies the Bullet There.

h4. Steps To Reproduce:

# Create a Page in Confluence.
# Add *4* lines of text to the page.
## Text1
## Text2
## Text3
## Text4
# Point the cursor to Text3.
# Click on Bullet/Numbered button.

h4.Expected Results:

Bullet/Number should apply to Text3 only.
 
h4.Actual Results:

Sometimes it applies the bullet correctly. Other times it jumps to the top row and applies the bullet there.
fields.summary: Bullet Applied to Wrong Line in IE 10 and IE 11

fields.description:
h5.Steps to Reproduce # Create a space, with two pages in it. Give each space a label of "related" # On the first page, create a Content By Label Macro, pointing to "related" # Create a third page, outside of your demo space, and give it a label of "related". It will show up in the first page as a link as well. # Export the space as HTML h5.Expected Behaviour There are two types of links - those that are in the same space, and those that are external to the space. * Internal Links should be rewritten to point to the generated HTML files, as inline links already are. * External Links should be rewritten to point to the full URL of the page so users can navigate from the exported space to the live instance h5.Actual Behaviour Links in the content by label macro are relative to Confluence and do not work correctly. Links outside the content by label macro are rendering correctly. {code}

Here's an inline link to another page in this space.

Test Page One Another related page outside the space {code}
fields.summary: Links in a Content by Label Macro are incorrect when the space is exported to HTML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34265].
  {panel}

h4. Scenario
When using the _noformat_ macro, having its placeholder expanded beyond uper and lower limits of the Confluence editor boundaries, the popup with "_Edit|Remove_" is displayed over the corner bottom left.

That can lead to a user accidentally hitting _Remove_ and losing the data on screen.

!Capture.JPG|thumbnail!

h4. Desired Fix
Place the popup somewhere else on the screen in a sense that it does not get in place of the cursor.
fields.summary: Macro popup appears over cursor at bottom of screen

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Trying to add JIRA Charts in Confluence page will render the chart properly in the screens before inserting it to the page, but clicking on _Insert_ will get the chart disssapear and the Confluence page is unable to be saved. Seems like Confluence renders JIRA Charts data using both Application URL and Display URL.

h4. Steps to reproduce
(*execute the test from machine1*)
# Set up JIRA on machine1 (sample IP: 10.60.5.193) and Confluence on machine2 (sample IP: 10.60.5.198)
# (Test scenario) Current Base URL of JIRA is *http://10.60.5.193:8630/jira* and Confluence is *http://10.60.5.198:10561/confluence*
# Set up /etc/hosts on machine1 with _127.0.0.1 jiraisawesome_
# Login to *http://10.60.5.193:8630/jira* from *machine1*
# Set up application link using IP and ports (e.g: connect to *http://10.60.5.198:10561/confluence*)
# Login to *http://10.60.5.198:10561/confluence* from *machine1*
# Create a new Confluence Page
# Insert JIRA Chart by searching any existing JIRA project and Save the page (_Chart is displayed successfully_)
# Login to *http://10.60.5.193:8630/jira* from *machine1*
# Change the base URL of JIRA to use *http://jiraisawesome:8630/jira*
# Login to *http://10.60.5.198:10561/confluence* from *machine1*
# Modify the application link of JIRA - Display URL in Confluence to use *http://jiraisawesome:8630/jira*
# Perform Step 7 and 8 again

Here are the results
* We can view the chart in the preview of the prompt, but when _insert_ the chart, its not showing in the page preview and unable to click on the save button.
* URLs of the problem can be seen in the browser's developer mode
{code}HTTP 200 http://jiraisawesome:8624/jira/charts?filename=jfreechart-onetime-2627007503907999135.png

HTTP 504 http://10.60.2.176:8553/553/plugins/servlet/image-generator?macro=jirachart&jql=project+%3D+DEMO&statType=assignees&appId=29d6aed3-a496-3929-a14b-c4653473b6b3&chartType=pie&authenticated=true{code}

h4. Logs information
* Confluence log
{noformat}2014-06-04 17:33:33,503 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-3] [confluence.plugins.jira.AbstractProxyServlet] requestByAnonymousUser Can not retrieve data from jira servers by anonymous user
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/image-generator | userName: admin
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.jira.ImageGeneratorServlet.handleResponse(ImageGeneratorServlet.java:185)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.jira.AbstractProxyServlet.requestByAnonymousUser(AbstractProxyServlet.java:176){noformat}
* JIRA logs
{noformat}2014-06-04 17:33:33,498 http-bio-8080-exec-6 ERROR anonymous 1053x2945x1 - 192.168.200.3 /rest/gadget/1.0/piechart/generate [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: parameter should not be null!
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.notNull(Assertions.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.charts.piechart.PieChartUrlGeneratorFactory.<init>(PieChartUrlGeneratorFactory.java:41){noformat}

h4. Additional Information
JIRA 6.2.7
Confluence 5.5.3

h4. Use case
There are users who configures JIRA and Confluence integration to be using a different Application URL than the Display URL. This configuration is used when the two servers not able to be contacted between each other using the Display URL. At times this is the prefered configuration with communication between two internal servers to be using internal IP/hostnames instead of the external IP/hostnames.

h4. Expected behaviour
The charts to be rendered normally in Confluence when using configurations of Display URL different than Application URL. With Display URL not necessarily able to reach the other server, but Application URL can.
fields.summary: JIRA Chart Not Rendered when Inserting to Confluence page and throwing 504 Error

fields.description:
When pressing ENTER on the first column, the table will be expanded as expected in edit mode.

On the other hand, when pressing SHIFT + ENTER on the first column, the table seems like it is broken in edit mode. This scenario only happens when using Mozilla Firefox.

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/123210/screenshot-1.png!

When saving and previewing the page, it seems the table is unaffected. However, it is troublesome and can be an eyesore for customers to use Confluence edit. 

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/123211/screenshot-2.png!

Workaround:
* Undo the previous move, and attempt SHIFT + ENTER table again works fine.
fields.summary: Mozilla Firefox SHIFT ENTER breaks table alignment

fields.description:
The Breadcrumb in Blogpost section is always JVM installed locale no matter which language pack you have selected.

!locale.PNG|thumbnail!


*Workaround* 
overriding the OS and JVM defaults by adding this to your Confluence system property:

Example: change to English 
{code}
-Duser.language.format=en -Duser.country.format=US
{code}

Refer to this article for instructions on how to add this argument: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties

Note: You will only change to one language,  so if your select language pack for confluence is japanese, you still will be seeing the breadcrumb in english unless you modify the language format to japanese
fields.summary: Blogpost Breadcrumb is always in JVM installed locale no matter which language pack you have selected

fields.description:
Impact is major, since all our development teams are using confluence to track release milestones and issues.  Not being able to render these charts and data are vital to their development efforts and productivity.

Confluence Version:  4.2.2
JIRA Version: 6.2.7

After upgrading from JIRA 5.2.7 to 6.2.7, JIRA gadgets used on Confluence pages were no longer displaying results.

We noticed this with the following gadgets:
Filter Results
Two Dimensional Filter Statistics

For Filter Results gadget, we looked at the configuration and it was no longer referencing a JIRA filter.

For Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget, it was displaying, "The filter for this gadget did not return any issues."   We looked at the configuration as there was a JIRA filter specified.  We would look on JIRA and found the filter.  

We have setup Application Links between JIRA and Confluence with trusted authentication, 
which is currently not working.  We have also used Basic Auth and that does not work
either.

We are seeing the following in the confluence log:
2014-07-13 23:12:56,865 WARN [TP-Processor33] [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] resolveDependencies Cannot find web resource module for: com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:common

2014-07-13 23:05:54,447 WARN [TP-Processor21] [auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator] authenticate Failed to login trusted application: jira:10357109 due to: com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.CertificateTooOldException: Certificate too old. Application: jira:10357109 Certificate Created: Sun Jul 13 23:05:34 CDT 2014 Timeout: 10000

It also looks similar to:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23761
fields.summary: Filter Results Lost After JIRA Upgrade

fields.description: We are using Confluence 5.4.4. Some of the links (pages) in our Confluence were renamed lately. The links can be opened in a Desktop version without any problem, however when SAME links are being opened in a mobile browser, "Page not found" appears. We have no problem opening links in mobile site, that were not changed in any way.
fields.summary: Mobile website can not open links that were renamed

fields.description:
Select Space Tools : Content Tools : Export : HTML : Next : Export.

Confluence generates HTML with links to absolute URLs (starting with /display) instead of relative URLs. Also the generated files have names with hyphens separating words and a number at the end, whereas the links have pluses between words and are missing the number.

For example it creates a file "Linux-Mint_1179884.html" but the link is to "/display/Linux+Mint"

The only file with links to Confluence Pages that works is index.html.
All the links in that file work.
fields.summary: links from one page to another are broken in HTML export

fields.description:
The Page properties macro includes web resources that are included in the mobile context. Recently these web resources have a dependency on AUI and are pulling in jQuery, Backbone, Rapheal, etc when viewing a page with the page property macro on Mobile. Confluence Mobile does not use AUI and should not have these resources. In some instances, the page cannot be rendered due to Soy template and global name clashes.

The solution to this is to separate out the JS resources into a separate web-resource and selectively exclude them in the mobile context.
fields.summary: Page properties (master details) macro pulls AUI into Confluence Mobile
Reflected XSS affecting Confluence via Gadgets

h3. The problem:
The move operation ("_Tools > Move_") moves the blogpost to the new space, but doesn't move the attachment causing the message "_Attachment File Not Found_" when trying to download the attachment.
!Attachment_File_Not_Found.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new blogpost;
# Add an attachment to this blogpost;
# Move the blogpost to a different space.

Enabling *DEBUG* for the classes _persistence.dao.filesystem.UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener_ and _com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao_ in the {{log4j.properties}} file brings the following information:
* Moving a _Page_ triggers the _UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener_ event and the attachments is moved as expected in the filesystem:
{noformat}
2014-07-11 16:40:47,953 DEBUG [http-bio-8552-exec-10] [persistence.dao.filesystem.UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener] moveAttachments page: page: test move v.1 (753665), old space Space{key='ds'}
...
2014-07-11 16:40:48,092 DEBUG [http-bio-8552-exec-10] [persistence.dao.hibernate.AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao] countLatestVersionsOfAttachments Querying database for attachment count on content ID: 753665

fields.description:
confluence-plugins/confluence-editor-plugins/confluence-editor-loader/src/main/resources/jscripts/editor-loader.js

editor-loader.js sets the global AJAX timeout for all requests initiated via $.ajax (which is pretty much all of them) to 12 seconds.

If an AJAX call that takes longer than 12 seconds is initiated on any page where the editor is loaded, the client will timeout and abort the request before it completes.

An example of this happening is moving a page with a large hierarchy, this generally takes longer than 12 seconds, and will show an error message before the operation completes.
fields.summary: editor-loader overrides global $.ajax timeout

fields.description:
Sometimes, the ancestors table gets out of synch and that can generate infinite loops when trying to generate the breadcrumbs or generating a page tree. This can lead to {{OutOfMemory}} and {{StackOverflow}} errors affecting the stability of Confluence.

We should be able to detect these loops and point the user to rebuild the ancestors table (or even rebuild it automatically).

h3. Workaround #1 (if only ancestors table is corrupted)
If you are facing this kind of problems try [Rebuilding the Ancestor Table|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Rebuilding+the+Ancestor+Table].

h3. Workaround #2 (if both content and ancestors table are corrupted)
* Disable tree macro (if eill make instance unusable in few minutes if enabled and loop exist)
* Find loop in db using
{noformat}
SELECT *
FROM content as parent
LEFT JOIN content AS child
ON child.parentid = parent.contentid
WHERE parent.parentid = child.contentid
{noformat}
query
* Fix parent<->child relation
* [Rebuild the Ancestor Table|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Rebuilding+the+Ancestor+Table]
* Enable tree macro
fields.summary: Detect loops when going through page tree structure

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34217].
  {panel}

By default, when a new user is created, it will be automatically added into {{confluence-users}} group.

When you want to assign the user to a another group, you will have to redirect into the "Groups" tab and and add membership to the user.

There may be some cases when Confluence Administrators removed {{confluence-users}} group and define its own "can-use" group members. When adding new user, the bug occurs where adding user permission is denied - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22778

It will be an additional feature and bonus in convenience for Confluence if Confluence Administrators would be able to define the group membership from the beginning so that the issue above can be prevented.
fields.summary: Apply Group Selection when Adding User in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Scenario

We have a page A and page B. If you get the full URL of the page B and create a web link for it inside the page A, it won't create a Incoming link on page B information pointing to page A.

h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Create a page, say "Main Page"
2. Create another page, doesn't have to be a child page, say "Sample Page"
3. Get the URL of "Sample Page"
4. Edit "Main Page", type any text, say "check here".
5. In the "here" text, click "Link". In the "Web link" section, paste the URL from step 3 in "Address" text box. Click Save and then another Save to the page.
6. Go to "Sample Page", click "Tools", then "Page Information". There are no reference to "Main Page" in the "Incoming Links" section. 

h3. Workaround
Paste the page URL directly inside the page not using a web link for it. Confluence will render the page link and create the incoming link in the page link as well.
fields.summary: Using web links does not create Incoming links on pages

# It should change to "Manage Permissions"; try to click that link
# You should get to an error page saying Not Permitted

Now, back as admin-user1, you can validate that admin-user2 got added to the individual users section as an Admin, but has no View access, so cannot see the admin page.

This is bad news if you dont have a fellow admin to help you unlock yourself or regain access.

fields.description:
Hi

A colleague of mine has reported some issues using confluence together with some suggested improvements for a future release in the email below. Would be greateful if someone is able to take a look at these. We are currently using version 5,4,3 of Confluence:

Major Confluence errors:

1.	Pasting from Word with formatting causes the Javascript to hang. This means that in order to paste content from Word into Confluence, the process involves pasting into Notepad of paste-special plain text into another Word document and then copying to the clipboard to paste into Confluence.
2.	Certain operations cause the cursor to move up one line so that typing starts in the wrong place e.g. in an indented list, after a back tab which moves the indent to the left, the cursor  sometimes jumps up one line.
3.	Pressing tab to indent a line sometimes causes the list to be messed up e.g. a new line is inserted below the indented line
4.	Confluence search and search and replace doesn't work
5.	Undo (CTRL-Z) often is unable to undo editing correctly.
6.	It is not possible to copy content from one Confluence page to another.

Minor Confluence errors errors:
7.	Every new table cell has a space in it (which has to be manually deleted)
8.	Doing control-Z to undo can cause the page to jump up (so that the undone line is at the top of the visible page)
9.	Pressing CTRL-F to search causes the IE and Confluence search boxes to appear (a minor problem, and indeed a good thing because Confluence search doesn't work)


Missing features in Confluence:

10.	No spell checker 

Confluence and Gliffy UI issues:

11.	 Gliffy and Confluence have different UIs e.g. shortcut keys e.g. Ctrl-B for bold doesn't work in Gliffy

Gliffy Errors
12.	 It is not possible to change a selected set of objects to be all bold if some of them are already bold i.e. bolding just toggles the state, so any already bolded items must be removed from the selection before selecting bold font (otherwise they are changed to not bold).
13.	Undo does not work e.g. connectors are not restored to their connected position

Gliffy missing features
14.	Gliffy needs more than one level of undo
fields.summary: Confluence Issues

fields.summary: findspaceattachments.jsp fails

fields.description:
When trying to change the page hierarchy using Internet Explorer 10.0.9200.16721 Update Version 10.0.10 (KB2879017) the page can be moved, but it won't be inserted at the correct hierarchy level. When dropping the issue it just stays at the dropped place without being integrated into the hierarchy.
Using Firefox 24 everything works OK
fields.summary: Unable to change page hierarchy using Internet Explorer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34202].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence display it's URL in full ASCII format. When special character is included in the URL, sometimes, this character is not properly recognize in the URL when send in the mail. 

For example
 # Create a new page
# Add a heading in the page "test?"
 # Add there the toc macro.
# Copy that URL, and send it through email to someone else.
# That person clicks on the URL, the wiki page opens, but does not direct to the correct heading.  You will notice the '?' character is not considered as a part of the URL:
!sample.png!

However this could be mitigated if the URL is encoded in the following format.  {{<confluence-URL>/display/VM/TEST#TEST%3F}}


This can be rather inconvience for user who wish to send Confluence URL in a mail.
fields.summary: Encoding ASCII Special Character in URL encoding.
